task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for current role and position of Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi at Microsoft
task_1.data: Based on the available information, there is no evidence that Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is currently employed at Microsoft. He has a background in data science, AI, and cloud computing, having worked at Microsoft for over eight years as a Principal Engineering Manager and Principal Development and Data Engineering Lead. During his tenure, he contributed to the simulator and AI platform used by Microsoft Azure and developed commercial and ecosystem platforms for container-based AI. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai)) After leaving Microsoft, he joined Amazon as a Software Development Manager in Media Planning. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo
Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo

task_2.query_used: Investigate professional publications or technical papers by Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi in AI and cloud infrastructure domains
task_2.data:
Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is a seasoned professional specializing in data science, artificial intelligence (AI), and cloud computing. He currently serves as a Software Development Manager in Media Planning at Amazon Ads. In this role, he leverages his expertise to enhance media planning strategies through advanced data analytics and AI-driven solutions. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

Before joining Amazon, Mehdi had an extensive tenure at Microsoft, spanning over eight years. During this period, he held positions such as Principal Engineering Manager and Principal Development and Data Engineering Lead. His notable contributions include developing the simulator and AI platform for Microsoft Azure, as well as building commercial and ecosystem platforms for container-based AI. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his corporate roles, Mehdi has been involved in entrepreneurial ventures. He served as a Principal Data Scientist at Intralinks and Quanttus, where he played a pivotal role in developing a wearable device designed to monitor blood pressure. His efforts were instrumental in securing seed and Series A funding from prominent venture capital firms, including Khosla Ventures and Sequoia Capital. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

Mehdi's academic contributions are also noteworthy. He co-authored a paper titled "A Roadmap for Navigating the Life Sciences Linked Open Data Cloud," presented at the Joint International Semantic Technology Conference (JIST) in 2014. This work addresses the challenges and strategies for navigating the complex landscape of life sciences linked open data. ([dblp.org](https://dblp.org/pid/134/9923.html?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi's career reflects a strong commitment to advancing AI and cloud infrastructure, both through his professional roles and academic endeavors.

citations.title: Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo
Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo

task_3.query_used: Search Microsoft corporate website and employee directory for professional profile
task_3.data:
I couldn't locate a professional profile of Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi on Microsoft's corporate website or employee directory. However, available information indicates that he has a significant background in data science, AI, and cloud computing. He worked at Microsoft for over eight years, serving as Principal Engineering Manager and Principal Development and Data Engineering Lead. During his tenure, he contributed to the simulator and AI platform used by Microsoft Azure and played a key role in developing commercial and ecosystem platforms for container-based AI. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

After his time at Microsoft, Mehdi joined Amazon as a Software Development Manager in Media Planning for Amazon Ads. Additionally, he serves on the Board of Directors for elile.ai. ([datasciencedojo.com](https://datasciencedojo.com/speaker/muntazir-mehdi/?utm_source=openai))

Mehdi has also been involved in research, with publications focusing on Bayesian and machine learning applications. He is currently a Research Scholar at RMIT University in Melbourne, Australia, in the Department of Mathematical Sciences. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-14?utm_source=openai))

In the field of intellectual property, Mehdi has filed patents related to network optimization and capacity engineering in distributed computing systems. ([patents.justia.com](https://patents.justia.com/inventor/muhammad-muntazir-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo
Muntazir Mehdi | Future of Data and AI - Amazon | Data Science Dojo

task_4.query_used: Check academic databases and research repositories for scholarly works or conference presentations
task_4.data:
Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi has contributed to several scholarly works across diverse fields. Notable publications include:

1. **Prevalence of Anxiety and Depression among Orthopedic Trauma Inpatients**: This study, co-authored with Waleed Ali, Muhammad Fahim Qasim, Adil Saidullah, Rizwan Farooq, and Abid Munir, was published in the *Pakistan Journal of Medical & Health Sciences*. The research aimed to determine the prevalence of anxiety and depression among orthopedic trauma patients. The study found that these patients often experience emotional disorders, with anxiety and depression levels increasing after surgery. The authors suggest that clinicians should closely monitor geriatric patients for these psychological issues. ([pjmhsonline.com](https://pjmhsonline.com/index.php/pjmhs/article/view/3875?utm_source=openai))

2. **Disparities in Liver Transplantation Rates and Outcomes Among Adults with and Without Mental Illnesses**: Co-authored with Usama Waqar, Selamawit Woldesenbet, Muhammad Musaab Munir, Yutaka Endo, Erryk Katayama, Vivian Resende, Mujtaba Khalil, Karol Rawicz-Pruszy≈Ñski, and Parit Mavani, this article was published in the *Journal of Gastrointestinal Surgery*. The study examined the rates of evaluation, transplantation, and post-transplant outcomes among patients with and without mental illnesses. The findings revealed that patients with mental illnesses had lower rates of evaluation and transplantation but did not experience significant differences in postoperative outcomes compared to those without mental illnesses. ([ecommons.aku.edu](https://ecommons.aku.edu/pakistan_fhs_mc_mc/378/?utm_source=openai))

3. **Variations in Medicare Reimbursements Among Surgical Oncologists Who Are US Versus International Medical Graduates**: In this research, co-authored with Abdullah Altaf, Mujtaba Khalil, Sidharth Iyer, Razeen Thamachack, Zayed Rashid, Timothy M. Pawlik, and Abdul Hadi Shahid, the authors analyzed variations in practice metrics and billing practices among US Medical Graduates (USMGs) and International Medical Graduates (IMGs) in surgical oncology. The study found that IMGs provided more procedural services, cared for patients with higher average risk scores, and performed a greater variety of procedures compared to USMGs. Consequently, IMGs had higher mean annual charges, payment-per-service, and charge-per-service amounts. ([ecommons.aku.edu](https://ecommons.aku.edu/pakistan_fhs_mc_mc/496/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi has been involved in patent development, including a method and apparatus for optimizing legacy network infrastructure and capacity engineering in distributed computing systems. ([patents.justia.com](https://patents.justia.com/inventor/muhammad-muntazir-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

Furthermore, he has a research profile at RMIT University in Melbourne, Australia, focusing on the applications of clustering across various domains, including Bayesian and machine learning. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-14?utm_source=openai))

These contributions highlight his diverse expertise in medical research, network optimization, and statistical analysis.

citations.title: Prevalence of Anxiety and Depression among Orthopedic Trauma Inpatients | Pakistan Journal of Medical & Health Sciences
"Disparities in liver transplantation rates and outcomes among adults w" by Usama Waqar, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi Khan et al.

task_5.query_used: Review technology conference speaker lists and tech industry event archives for potential presentations
task_5.data:
Dr. Muntazir Hussain has been actively involved in various academic and professional events, contributing significantly to the fields of engineering and technology. Notably, he served as a member of the Local Organizing Team for the RTIP2R 2023 conference at the University of Derby, UK, alongside colleagues Yagna Jadeja and Nahid Sami. ([rtip2r-conference.org](https://rtip2r-conference.org/2023/committees.html?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Dr. Hussain has been a keynote speaker at the 4th International Conference on Communication Technologies (ComTech 2023), held from March 15 to March 16, 2023. ([scme.nust.edu.pk](https://scme.nust.edu.pk/faculty/abdul-qadeer-malik/NA/ww.ssuet.edu.pk/Risk-Taking%20Behaviour%20of%20Pedestrians%20on%20National%20Highways%20of%20Pakistan/doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-61582-5_7/?utm_source=openai))

His extensive research contributions are highlighted in his curriculum vitae, which details numerous publications in reputable journals and conferences, reflecting his expertise and active participation in the academic community. ([sites.google.com](https://sites.google.com/view/engr-dr-muntazir-hussain/curriculum-vitae?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Committee (RTIP2R 2023)
Faculty - National University of Sciences and Technology (NUST)

task_6.query_used: Search GitHub, Stack Overflow, or technical developer platforms for professional contributions
task_6.data:
Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is a seasoned software architect with over nine years of experience in designing scalable cloud-native solutions, AI systems, and fintech platforms. He has expertise in leading teams, microservices, and aligning technical solutions with business goals. His technical skills encompass Node.js, React, Angular, Flutter, Python, Java, PHP, and various other technologies. He has worked on projects such as fine-tuning the Llama 3.1 model on Hugging Face and developing the iAgility cloud-based platform. ([mehdibukhari.github.io](https://mehdibukhari.github.io/?utm_source=openai))

On GitHub, under the username 'MehdiKhosa50', he has contributed to several repositories, including:

- **Creating-a-Blockchain-from-Scratch-with-Javascript**: A project focused on building a blockchain using JavaScript.

- **Flash-Loans**: An implementation of flash loans by forking the Binance Smart Chain Mainnet Network and integrating the Uniswap protocol.

- **JavascriptLearningBasics**: A repository covering core concepts of JavaScript programming, along with two projects.

- **LearningSmartContract**: A collection of core concepts for building smart contracts using Solidity.

- **PeoplesStakingDapp**: A Solidity-based staking system that allows users to stake ERC20 tokens and earn rewards over time.

- **TrustFundDAO**: A public funding decentralized application (DApp) for charity projects, where majority contributors can decide where to spend their money.

These projects highlight his proficiency in blockchain development and smart contract implementation. ([github.com](https://github.com/MehdiKhosa50?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, he has a presence on Stack Overflow under the username 'Muhammad Mehdi', where he has accumulated 532 reputation points over 12 years and 4 months. His contributions include answering questions related to ReactJS, JavaScript, Material-UI, Angular, and React Hooks. Notably, he received a gold badge for a 'Famous Question' in September 2021. ([stackoverflow.com](https://stackoverflow.com/users/10513037/muhammad-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

Furthermore, he has been active in the academic and research community, with publications in life sciences, endpoints, shear stress, and linked data. His work has been cited 61 times, with an h-index of 3, indicating a significant impact in his field. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/896131/syed-muhammad-muntazir-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

In summary, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi's professional contributions span software architecture, blockchain development, and academic research, reflecting his diverse expertise and commitment to technological advancement.

MehdiKhosa50 (Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi) ¬∑ GitHub

task_8.query_used: Check professional networking sites like ResearchGate or Google Scholar for academic or research credentials
task_8.data:
Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is an academic researcher with a diverse background in biotechnology, environmental protection, and machine learning applications in healthcare. He has been affiliated with several institutions, including the University of Silesia in Katowice, the University of Derby, and RMIT University.

At the University of Silesia in Katowice, he collaborated on research projects focusing on the identification of novel microRNAs and their target genes in response to abscisic acid in Arabidopsis, contributing to multiple publications and presentations. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Syed-Muhammad-Muntazir-Mehdi?utm_source=openai))

During his tenure at the University of Derby, Mehdi's research centered on federated learning in healthcare, resulting in publications that address preserving accuracy in federated learning models and handling unreliable client contributions. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-10?utm_source=openai))

Currently, as a PhD researcher at RMIT University's Department of Mathematical Sciences, he is investigating the applications of clustering in various domains, including Bayesian and machine learning. His work aims to explore the practical applications of mathematics and statistics across different fields. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-14?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Mehdi has a Google Scholar profile associated with Ohio State University, where he has contributed to research in surgical oncology, focusing on outcomes following resection for hepatocellular carcinoma and pancreatic cancer. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=KpZ3kSAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

His academic contributions are also recognized by the AD Scientific Index, which ranks him among the top scientists in Business & Management/Marketing. ([adscientificindex.com](https://www.adscientificindex.com/scientist/syed-muntazir-mehdi/5748851?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi's research spans multiple disciplines, reflecting his commitment to advancing knowledge in both biological sciences and data-driven methodologies.

citations.title: Syed Muhammad Muntazir MEHDI | Phd | University of Silesia in Katowice, Katowice | Biotechnology and Environmental Protection | Research profile
Muntazir MEHDI | PhD Researcher | Doctor of Philosophy | University of Derby, Derby | College of Science and Engineering | Research profile

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary

Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is a seasoned software architect with experience in cloud-native solutions, AI systems, and fintech platforms. He has a background in data science, AI, and cloud computing, and has contributed to academic research. There is no immediate indication of high risk, but his involvement in technology and research warrants continued monitoring.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**

*   Experienced software architect with over nine years of experience.
*   Expertise in designing scalable cloud-native solutions, AI systems, and fintech platforms.
*   Experience leading teams and aligning technical solutions with business goals.
*   Previously worked at Microsoft for over eight years as a Principal Engineering Manager and Principal Development and Dat.
*   Speaker at Data Science Dojo.

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**

*   No specific financial or corporate ties are mentioned beyond his employment history.

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**

*   No legal or regulatory issues were found.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**

*   Co-authored a study on the "Prevalence of Anxiety and Depression among Orthopedic Trauma Inpatients."
*   Co-authored a study on "Disparities in liver transplantation rates and outcomes among adults."
*   Dr. Muntazir Hussain served as a member of the Local Organizing Team for the RTIP2R 2023 conference at the University of Derby, UK.

**5. Online / Social Media**

*   GitHub profile: MehdiKhosa50.
*   Personal website: mehdibukhari.github.io.

**6. Additional Observations**

*   His GitHub account suggests involvement in software development projects.

### Risk Score

**Low to Medium**. Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi appears to be a technology professional and researcher with no immediately apparent high-risk factors. However, his involvement in AI and software development, coupled with his research activities, warrants continued monitoring for potential reputational or security risks.

flagged_issues: Conflation of multiple individuals named Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi - the report mixes information about at least 3 different people
Contradictory employment information - states he worked at Microsoft but evidence shows he left Microsoft for Amazon
Academic publications attributed to subject appear to be from different researchers with similar names
Dr. Muntazir Hussain mentioned in evidence is a different person entirely
No verification that the GitHub profile 'MehdiKhosa50' belongs to the same person as the Microsoft/Amazon employee
Missing temporal context - report doesn't clarify current employment status

risk_signals: Subject appears to be a legitimate technology professional with no criminal or regulatory issues identified
Involvement in AI and cloud computing technologies presents minimal security concerns in absence of other risk factors
Academic publications in medical/healthcare fields appear to be from different individuals with similar names
No evidence of financial misconduct, legal issues, or controversial activities

judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary

Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is a software development professional with expertise in cloud computing and AI systems. Based on available evidence, he previously worked at Microsoft for over eight years as a Principal Engineering Manager and Principal Development and Data Engineering Lead, before joining Amazon as a Software Development Manager in Media Planning¬π. Due to name similarities, care must be taken to distinguish this individual from other researchers with similar names.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**

* Previously employed at Microsoft for 8+ years in senior engineering roles¬π
* Contributed to simulator and AI platform used by Microsoft Azure¬π
* Developed commercial and ecosystem platforms for container-based AI¬π
* Currently or recently employed at Amazon as Software Development Manager in Media Planning¬π
* Listed as speaker at Data Science Dojo¬π
* Self-described as software architect with 9+ years experience in cloud-native solutions¬≤

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**

* No specific financial irregularities or concerning corporate relationships identified
* Employment history limited to major technology companies (Microsoft, Amazon)

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**

* No legal or regulatory issues identified in available sources

**4. Academic / Public Presence**

* Personal website: mehdibukhari.github.io¬≤
* Note: Medical research publications found under similar names (Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi) appear to belong to different individuals and cannot be reliably attributed to this subject

**5. Online / Social Media**

* GitHub profile 'MehdiKhosa50' shows blockchain and JavaScript projects¬≤
* Stack Overflow presence under 'Muhammad Mehdi' with 532 reputation points¬≤
* Verification needed to confirm these profiles belong to the same individual

**6. Additional Observations**

* Multiple individuals with the name Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi exist in academic and professional contexts
* Evidence suggests at least one medical researcher and one technology professional share similar names
* Dr. Muntazir Hussain mentioned in some search results is a different person entirely

### Risk Assessment

**Risk Level: LOW**

The subject appears to be a legitimate technology professional with standard career progression through major technology companies. No evidence of criminal activity, regulatory violations, or reputational concerns was identified. The primary challenge in assessment is distinguishing between multiple individuals with similar names.

### Footnotes
¬π Data Science Dojo speaker profile
¬≤ Personal website and GitHub profile (verification of ownership pending)

- **Creating-a-Blockchain-from-Scratch-with-Javascript**: A project focused on building a blockchain using JavaScript.

- **Flash-Loans**: An implementation of flash loans by forking the Binance Smart Chain Mainnet Network and integrating the Uniswap protocol.

- **JavascriptLearningBasics**: A repository covering core concepts of JavaScript programming, along with two projects.

- **LearningSmartContract**: A collection of core concepts for building smart contracts using Solidity.

- **PeoplesStakingDapp**: A Solidity-based staking system that allows users to stake ERC20 tokens and earn rewards over time.

- **TrustFundDAO**: A public funding decentralized application (DApp) for charity projects, where majority contributors can decide where to spend their money.

These projects highlight his proficiency in blockchain development and smart contract implementation. ([github.com](https://github.com/MehdiKhosa50?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, he has a presence on Stack Overflow under the username 'Muhammad Mehdi', where he has accumulated 532 reputation points over 12 years and 4 months. His contributions include answering questions related to ReactJS, JavaScript, Material-UI, Angular, and React Hooks. Notably, he received a gold badge for a 'Famous Question' in September 2021. ([stackoverflow.com](https://stackoverflow.com/users/10513037/muhammad-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

Furthermore, he has been active in the academic and research community, with publications in life sciences, endpoints, shear stress, and linked data. His work has been cited 61 times, with an h-index of 3, indicating a significant impact in his field. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/896131/syed-muhammad-muntazir-mehdi?utm_source=openai))

In summary, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi's professional contributions span software architecture, blockchain development, and academic research, reflecting his diverse expertise and commitment to technological advancement.

task_8.query_used: Check professional networking sites like ResearchGate or Google Scholar for academic or research credentials
task_8.data:
Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi is an academic researcher with a diverse background in biotechnology, environmental protection, and machine learning applications in healthcare. He has been affiliated with several institutions, including the University of Silesia in Katowice, the University of Derby, and RMIT University.

At the University of Silesia in Katowice, he collaborated on research projects focusing on the identification of novel microRNAs and their target genes in response to abscisic acid in Arabidopsis, contributing to multiple publications and presentations. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Syed-Muhammad-Muntazir-Mehdi?utm_source=openai))

During his tenure at the University of Derby, Mehdi's research centered on federated learning in healthcare, resulting in publications that address preserving accuracy in federated learning models and handling unreliable client contributions. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-10?utm_source=openai))

Currently, as a PhD researcher at RMIT University's Department of Mathematical Sciences, he is investigating the applications of clustering in various domains, including Bayesian and machine learning. His work aims to explore the practical applications of mathematics and statistics across different fields. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Muntazir-Mehdi-14?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Mehdi has a Google Scholar profile associated with Ohio State University, where he has contributed to research in surgical oncology, focusing on outcomes following resection for hepatocellular carcinoma and pancreatic cancer. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=KpZ3kSAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

His academic contributions are also recognized by the AD Scientific Index, which ranks him among the top scientists in Business & Management/Marketing. ([adscientificindex.com](https://www.adscientificindex.com/scientist/syed-muntazir-mehdi/5748851?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Muhammad Muntazir Mehdi's research spans multiple disciplines, reflecting his commitment to advancing knowledge in both biological sciences and data-driven methodologies.
